text: [Music]
Mysteries of
vernacular.
Assassin. A murderer who relies on the
element of surprise to attack a
prominent personage. The word assassin
comes from the Arabic
hashesin which means hash user. The
history of hashashin is sensational but
unconfirmed. In the early 11th century,
a man named Al-Hassin Iban al-Saba
became the leader of a band of Persian
extremists. According to legend and
various tenuous accounts, Al-Hassan gave
his men hashish as a way of deceiving
them into loyalty. These young men
became known as Ashesin or followers of
Hassan. From their fortress in the
mountains, Al Hassan ordered his men who
were highly trained warriors to do away
with his enemies.
No one was safe. From sultanss to
counts, the ashes spread terror
throughout the region. When the word
ashes was transmuted into English, the
pluralizing suffix in was mistaken to be
part of the word. For this reason, the
modern word assassin is
singular, referring to only one surprise
murderer. As if that weren't enough,
